sen.j: 大碓皇子（おおうすのみこ）は記紀に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Prince Oousu (Oousu no Mikoto) appeared in the Kiki ("Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matter] and the "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun (tumulus period) period in Japan.

Prince Oousu (Oousu no Mikoto) appeared in the Kiki ("Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matter] and the "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun (tumulus period) period in Japan.

Prince Oousu (Oousu no Mikoto) appeared in the Kiki ("Kojiki" [A Record of Ancient Matter] and the "Nihonshoki" [Chronicles of Japan]) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun (tumulus period) period in Japan.
Prince Oousu (大碓皇子) was also written in this way, "Oousu no Mikoto (大碓命)."
Prince Oousu (大碓皇子) was also written as Oousu no Mikoto (大碓命).
sen.cmt: ダブルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Oousu (大碓皇子) was also written as Oousu no Mikoto (大碓命).
Prince Oousu was a prince of the Emperor Keiko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Prince Oousu was a prince of the Emperor Keiko.
Prince Oousu was a prince of the Emperor Keiko.
The mother of Prince Oousu was Harima no Inabi no Oiratsume.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The mother of Prince Oousu was Harima no Inabi no Oiratsume.
The mother of Prince Oousu was Harima no Inabi no Oiratsume.

sen.j: 同母兄に櫛角別王、双子の弟に日本武尊（日本武尊）がおり、異母兄弟に成務天皇がいる。
sen.e: The maternal brothers (the son of the Emperor Keiko) of Prince Oousu were Prince Kushitsunowake [(櫛角別王) Kushitsunowake no Miko] and Prince Yamato Takeru [(日本武尊) Yamato Takeru no Mikoto], his twin brother.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The maternal half-brothers of Prince Oousu were Prince Kushitsunowake and Prince Yamato Takeru, his twin brother.
sen.cmt: his→her、同母兄の変更しました。
sen.e: The maternal half-brothers of Prince Oousu were Prince Kushitsunowake and Prince Yamato Takeru, his twin brother.

sen.j: 異母兄弟に成務天皇がいる。
sen.e: The Emperor Seimu (成務天皇) was a paternal half brother of Prince Oousu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Emperor Seimu was a paternal half-brother of Prince Oousu.
sen.cmt: スペースの挿入しました。
sen.e: The Emperor Seimu was a paternal half-brother of Prince Oousu.

sen.j: 牟義都（むげつ、牟宜都・身毛津）君の祖。
sen.e: Prince Oousu was an ancestor of Mugetsu [(牟義都); it was also written in "牟宜都"and "身毛津," but always pronounced as "Mugetsu."].
Prince Oousu was an ancestor of Mugetsu [(牟義都); it was also written in "牟宜都"and "身毛津," but always pronounced as "Mugetsu."].
Prince Oousu was an ancestor of Mugetsu [(牟義都); it was also written in "牟宜都" and "身毛津," but always pronounced as "Mugetsu."].

sen.j: 大碓は、美濃国の美女二人を宮中に迎えるよう父天皇より遣わされる。
sen.e: The Emperor Keiko ordered Prince Oousu on a mission; the Emperor sent him to Mino Province, instruction him to escort two beautiful ladies to the Imperial court.
The Emperor Keiko ordered Prince Oousu on a mission; the Emperor sent him to Mino Province, instruction him to escort two beautiful ladies to the Imperial court.
The Emperor Keiko ordered Prince Oousu on a mission; the Emperor sent him to Mino Province, instruction him to escort two beautiful ladies to the Imperial court.

sen.j: しかし、密通して復命せず、天皇の恨みを買ってしまう。
sen.e: However, Prince Oousu committed adultery with one lady (or the ladies) and did not complete his mission, incurring the Emperor Keiko's ill will.
However, Prince Oousu committed adultery with one lady (or the ladies) and did not complete his mission, incurring the Emperor Keiko's ill will.
However, Prince Oousu committed adultery with one lady (or the ladies) and did not complete his mission, incurring the Emperor Keiko's ill will.

sen.j: その後、『古事記』によれば、朝夕の会食に出席しなかったため、便所に入ったところを小碓に襲われた。
sen.e: In a later period of time, according to the "Kojiki," because Prince Oousu (大碓) didn't attend breakfast and dinner meetings with family, he was attacked by Prince Ousu [(小碓) or (小碓命) 'Ousu no Mikoto; this would have been the original (childhood) name of his twin brother, Prince Yamato Takeru (日本武尊).] when he entered into the bathroom.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In a later period of time, according to the "Kojiki," because Prince Oousu didn't attend breakfast and dinner meetings with family, he was attacked by Prince Ousu when he entered the bathroom.
In a later period of time, according to the "Kojiki," because Prince Oousu didn't attend breakfast and dinner meetings with family, he was attacked by Prince Ousu when he entered the bathroom.

sen.j: 手足をもぎとられ、薦に包まれて捨てられたとされる。
sen.e: Afterward, Prince Ousu [(小碓); Prince Yamato Takeru] severed his [Prince Oousu (大碓)] hands and feet then wrapped his body in straw matting, and disposed him in unknown location.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Afterward, Prince Ousu [(小碓); Prince Yamato Takeru] severed his [Prince Oousu (大碓)] hands and feet then wrapped his body in straw matting, and disposed him in unknown location.
Afterward, Prince Ousu [(小碓); Prince Yamato Takeru] severed his [Prince Oousu (大碓)] hands and feet then wrapped his body in straw matting, and disposed him in unknown location.

sen.j: しかし、『日本書紀』にこの話は見えない。
sen.e: However, this story was not in "Nihonshoki."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, this story was not in "Nihonshoki."
However, this story was not in "Nihonshoki."

sen.j: 景行天皇40年、蝦夷征伐の命を恐れて逃亡し、美濃国に封ぜられたという。
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki," and other historical books, in '114,' Prince Oousu ran away because he was afraid of the order, the Emishi Seito [(蝦夷征伐); the conquest of Emishi (蝦夷), who were a group of people living in the northern part of land.] and was then confined in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki," and other historical books, in 114, Prince Oousu ran away because he was afraid of the order, the Emishi Seito (the conquest of Emishi, who were a group of people living in the northern part of land) and was then confined in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki," and other historical books, in 114, Prince Oousu ran away because he was afraid of the order, the Emishi Seito (the conquest of Emishi, who were a group of people living in the northern part of land) and was then confined in Mino Province.

sen.j: 愛知県豊田市猿投町の猿投神社は大碓命を主祭神とし、西宮後方にはその墓が伝えられる。
sen.e: The Sanage Shrine, located in Sanage-Cho, Toyota City, Aichi Prefecture, has worshiped Prince Oousu as the shusaijin (main enshrined deities), and there is the tomb as his burial place in the back of the Nishinomiya, inside the Shrine property.

The Sanage Shrine, located in Sanage-Cho, Toyota City, Aichi Prefecture, has worshiped Prince Oousu as the shusaijin (main enshrined deities), and there is the tomb as his burial place in the back of the Nishinomiya, inside the Shrine property.

The Sanage Shrine, located in Sanage-Cho, Toyota City, Aichi Prefecture, has worshiped Prince Oousu as the shusaijin (main enshrined deities), and there is the tomb as his burial place in the back of the Nishinomiya, inside the Shrine property.

sen.j: なお同社の伝承によれば、大碓命は美濃に封じられて後、当地方の開拓に尽くした。
sen.e: Additionally, according to the traditional story which was passed onward from the founder of the Shrine; after Prince Oousu was confined in Mino Province, he put his efforts into developing this local area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, according to the traditional story which was passed onward from the founder of the Shrine; after Prince Oousu was confined in Mino Province, he put his efforts into developing this local area.

Additionally, according to the traditional story which was passed onward from the founder of the Shrine; after Prince Oousu was confined in Mino Province, he put his efforts into developing this local area.

sen.j: 景行天皇52年、猿投山に登る中途で蛇毒のために薨去、時に42歳という。
sen.e: However, in '126,' he was bitten by snake while climbing the Sanage mountain; then, he would meet with his demise from the venomous poison of the snake, at the age of forty two.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, in 126, he was bitten by snake while climbing the Sanage mountain; then, he would meet with his demise from the venomous poison of the snake, at the age of forty two.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: However, in 126, he was bitten by snake while climbing the Sanage mountain; then, he would meet with his demise from the venomous poison of the snake, at the age of forty two.
